intro: Ayushania circaeoides, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central corolla. Ayushania circaeoides is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in poor soil conditions.
